Summary Skilled in Resource co-ordination and management in an end to end environment. Primarily experienced in the IT and T sector. 
Experienced in a PMO environment. 
Experience dealing with Resource Management Boards, Statement of Works quotes, Professional Services organisations and procurement both local and overseas. Summary Skilled in Resource co-ordination and management in an end to end environment. Primarily experienced in the IT and T sector.

Experience dealing with Resource Management Boards, Statement of Works quotes, Professional Services organisations and procurement both local and overseas. Experience Contractor Engagement Coordinator Jemena June 2010  –  March 2014  (3 years 10 months) Mount Waverley •	In this role I was responsible for ensuring that necessary controls in the process of recruiting contractors are maintained and further strengthened across Jemena and EB Services 
•	Another key focus of my role was to examine the current contractors to reduce risk with respect to Legislative or statutory requirements. This not only included PI and PL but current certificates of currency and also contractors who represented a risk in job functions.( ie long term contractors holding roles deemed core to the business) 
•	The core function of my role required a lot of creating contractor records in SAP, maintaining forms and management approvals as well as any monitoring and reporting on a daily basis needed by the business. 
 Resource Coordinator IBM November 2008  –  October 2009  (1 year) My role required both co-ordination and management of the resource process between line/hiring Managers, agencies on the panel, procurement( both local and international) and internal applicants or redeployments of resources. 
•	I was hired in a contract capacity via Manpower to work as resource coordinator for IBM on the Telstra Account. I worked directly for the workforce planning manager in a team of permanent and contractors. I worked in a team 8. 
 
•	This position required me to create and maintain contractor files. This would include names, contract length, hiring manager, job functions and job family, agency, rates and anything else relevant. 
•	The majority of my role required me to interact directly with procurement, key business stakeholders, line managers, Hiring managers and all recruitment agencies on the Panel. IBM had very strict PSA (Preferred Supplier Agreement) panels which operated in a “trickledown” effect. There were PSA band 1, 2 and 3. I was constantly holding briefing sessions, phone conversations and emails updating all stakeholders at any given point in time. 
 
•	Towards the end of my role there was another restructure and many roles were offshoring. This meant I had to create training material for hand over to another division of the company located outside of Australia. 
The Telstra Transformation Release 2.2 (TR22) program was a significant and challenging undertaking involving 140 individual projects comprising 13,000 project tasks with 4000 milestones, all completed between September, 2008 and July, 2009. Over 600 new operating system images and 
375 databases were created, along with over 5000 batch jobs designed, configured, and implemented into production. The team supported 36 transformed client critical business applications during the installation. 
Whilst with IBM one of my career highlights was being recognised for part of the Service Delivery Quality Excellence Award Winner for July 2009 for my resourcing work for Telstra TR2.2. Associate Consultant/Delivery Consultant Hudson January 2007  –  November 2008  (1 year 11 months) •	Sourcing of candidates contained on a database containing over 16,000 candidates. Majority of these candidates are infrastructure and specialist based, predominantly around telecommunications. Please note I have also had the opportunity to work on 8 General Manager level roles late last year which has increased my skills working at such a level. 
 
•	As part of my role I am often handed roles too hard to fill by other consultants to work on and source candidates due to my experience and my different approach to finding candidates. I often utilise my network I have built up over the last 6 years. 
 
•	Work as part of a projects/special delivery team and am floated to other areas of IT when my area is slow. This has given me the chance to work across many clients and hone my skills picking the culture of an organisation very quickly 
 
•	Majority of roles were permanent. 
 
•	Attend onsite briefing and meet directly with hiring managers to take requirements. 
 
•	Work on a large number of open roles and am able to self prioritise the workload as my Manager is at times interstate. 
 
•	Received excellent rating in last review. 
 
•	Was the recipient of 2 internal IT awards. 
 Resourcer Candle ICT 2004  –  2007  (3 years) •	Sourcing of candidates contained on a database containing 14,000 candidates including experience using components of an ISYS search tool which interfaces to an internal Recruitment Management database.  
 
•	Work one on one with Account Manager on IT and some non IT roles for clients within IT Consultancy, Finance, Automotive, Insurance and some Retail/Manufacturing. 
•	Positions have been both contract and permanent in nature. 
 
•	My position has involved direct contact with high level Management, Hiring Managers, Service Delivery Managers and Team Leaders over the telephone to take new requirements on a daily basis, or when required. However when the situation allows I have also met face to face. I am comfortable with any communication medium with very senior management conducting myself in a professional and confident manner. 
 
•	Receive position/project descriptions on a daily basis. A proportion of the roles are for clients’ internal projects as I spend almost all of my time working for one client in a master vendor arrangement allowing very close interaction with the clients and its internal project resource management database. Roles can be project or at times, infrastructure related, such as SOE/upgrades or “back fill” roles to cover secondments. 
 
 
•	Given a confirmed start date for either the project “go live” or for when the resources are required by. This requires me to use the client’s resource allocation system, outlining resource requests numbers, assigning sourced person to resource request number and after a delay assigning the person to a purchase order. 
 
•	Other duties include attaching persons to the job, assigning rates/costing, attaching the person to the correct project position, confirming rate and tax codes and length of requirements. 
•	I have also sourced resources from other sites and states as is required especially when dealing with highly specialised skill. 
 Resourcer GCS group 2001  –  2004  (3 years) •	Sourcing of candidates contained on an Access database containing 11,000 candidates Sourcing of candidates also includes experience using the ISYS search tool. 
•	Liaison with Global and National IT firms from a variety of industry sectors, including technology, banking and finance, government, manufacturing, logistics and health. 
•	Attending client visitations with Account Managers and attending client briefings alone on many occasions. 
•	Key Resource Consultant for the professional services project team. Duties include sourcing and interviewing candidates as a result of resource requests relating to new project work, or additional resources required. This required me to work closely with the Professional Services Manager and the internal resource database for a major bank. 
 
•	Key resource consultant for tender work and contacting short listed candidates for the tender process. 
•	Running of and interpretation of reports relating to contractors’ renewal and expirations to successfully co-ordinate a deployment for one client's project to another.  
•	Facilitate fast turnaround time when an external resource request arises from a client. This can include management of resource related documentation such as contract generation, tracking in an excel spreadsheets as well as Probity Checks, facilitating Psychometric Assessments and associated transition paperwork. 
•	Interview candidates using specific interview templates, BEI and Core Competency interview techniques in addition to using personally developed technical questionnaires. 
•	Contract creation and official signing up of contractors 
•	Exposure to ASAP methodology and an understanding of the SDLC and its components.

Summary LEGACY WRITING: Documenting the stories of your family to pass down to future generations. 
 
My process is simple and gentle. I listen to the stories your family members wish to share, asking clarifying questions, taking notes, and recording our conversations along the way. I transcribe our discussions and recordings and weave the stories into a chronological narrative. You have input into revisions and edits after every new draft, until you are completely satisfied. The final product will be your heritage story--in your voice--in the form of a document, a bound book, a series of letters, or some other layout. Whatever you envision, I will do my best to provide. 
 
We all, whether prominent and prestigious or amazingly average, have a story worth telling! Don't wait until your family's stories become silenced by illness, age, or diminished cognition. 
 
My goal is to help you tell your story--whether it's a snapshot in time or a history spanning multiple generations--and I tend to specialize in long-term partnerships with my clients.  
 
If you have an idea in mind, please send me a message and introduce yourself. Tell me about your project, your audience, your budget, and your time frame. Every project is as unique as the stories being told, and therefore priced individually. My fees are reasonable and negotiable and our first meeting is complimentary. Summary Information drives me -- I have to understand how things connect and why they work. Within innovative industries, finding new ways to interpret information while designing alternative outcomes is what differentiates a successful business from others. You have to see your company, your industry, from an outsider's perspective to know where you may fall, and where you could land with a little preparation.  
 
I'm an analyst for the IT industry with a background in Power, Mainframe, and Security Systems. Research is my primary focus, but I also like taking that information and breaking it down into models that show the health of an industry (or product) now and in the future. Summary An outstanding customer service professional who maximizes resources and consistently enhances customer experiences by resolving problems -- and more importantly preventing them -- by working proactively, with great adaptability and superior communication skills. A motivated self-starter, able to grasp issues and attend to details while maintaining a view of the big picture. Expert in juggling multiple projects and achieving on-time completion within budget. Creative, resourceful and flexible, able to adapt to changing priorities and maintain a positive attitude and strong work ethic. A clear and logical communicator, able to establish rapport with both clients and colleagues and motivate individuals to achieve organizational objectives.
